page.title: 14ACTIVITIES - CHURCH HALL (3)
page.content: The{Bourne Valley Gardeners Club} started in 1981 and now has 120 members. There are 5 meetings a year and an outing. In 1985 they visited the gardens at Wisley. The A.G.M. is held in November and meetings then stop until February. Speakers at club meetings have included an Ex-Curator of Kew Gardens and the Superintendent of Wisley. The committee of 7 is nominated at the A.G.M. or co-opted as required, several are Founder Members. The{Whist Club}is an off-shoot of the Horticultural Society, and attracts between 12 and 20 players at it's monthly meetings. It raises a steady income for the Society and also donates prizes for the Flower Show. Additional money raised at special events in the last year was given to the Macmillan Nurses Appeal and Guide Dogs for the Blind.
